intro: Monnina speciosa, commonly known as the showy monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Monnina speciosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
